description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3dqv8","text":"Obtaining quality genomic material from Entomophthoralean fungi has proven extremely difficult. This protocol describes a method that has been successfully used to obtain high molecular weight genomic DNA from the obligate fungal pathogen Entomophthora muscae for long-read sequencing and genome assembly. The protocol details quality control and quantification steps recommended before proceeding to downstream applications, such as sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":239,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

references.title: UP-PCR analysis and ITS1 ribotyping of strains of Trichoderma and Gliocladium.
references.authors: Bulat SA, Lübeck M, Mironenko N, Jensen DF, Lübeck PS

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2i4sb","text":"Fungal culture can be established from glycerol freezer stock or from a sporulating cadaver following methods outlined in Hajek et al, 2012. Briefly, using aseptic technique: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bli1j","text":"-Adhere cadaver via ventral abdomen to the top of an inverted sterile petri dish and allow to sporulate for several hours (at least   and no more than  ) onto the base of the dish.
